title: 2 Easy Ways to Wrap Text In a Table in Microsoft Word

steps.title: Right-click the table.
steps.content: Right-click the table . A drop-down menu will open. Use this method to apply text wrapping to text outside of the table . This will change how text appears surrounding your text. [1] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source To apply text wrapping inside the table, skip to the next method .

steps.title: Click Table Properties.
steps.content: Click Table Properties . This is towards the bottom of the drop-down menu. A new window will open.

steps.title: Under "Text Wrapping", select Around.
steps.content: Under "Text Wrapping", select Around . This adds text wrapping to the outside of your table. If desired, you can set the Alignment as Left , Center , or Right .

steps.title: Adjust the positioning (optional).
steps.content: Adjust the positioning (optional). If you want to add more customizations, click Positioningâ€¦ on the right side of the menu. Set the Horizontal and/or Vertical Position as: Left, Right, Center, Inside, or Outside relative to: Margin, Page, or Column. Specify the distance from the surrounding text by clicking the up or down arrows for Top, Bottom, Left, or Right. Apply more options such as: Move with text or Allow overlap . Click OK when you're finished.

steps.title: Click OK.
steps.content: Click OK . This will save your changes.

steps.title: Click the table.
steps.content: Click the table. This will select it. By default, Microsoft Word automatically wraps text inside of a table cell. If you set rows to be a specific height, they will not change as you add content to the cells. Use this method to allow the cells to expand or revert back to default. steps.title: Click the tablet handle on the top-left corner.
steps.content: Click the tablet handle on the top-left corner. The entire table will be selected.

steps.title: Right-click the table and select Table Properties.
steps.content: Right-click the table and select Table Properties . This is towards the bottom of the drop-down menu.

steps.title: Click Row.
steps.content: Click Row . This is the tab at the top, between Table and Column .

steps.title: Select the "Specify height" box.
steps.content: Select the "Specify height" box. There should be a checkmark, and the drop-down menus will no longer be grayed out. If you want to remove a height specification entirely, uncheck the box so there's no checkmark. Then, click OK to save your changes.

steps.title: Click the drop-down menu next to "Row height is".
steps.content: Click the drop-down menu next to "Row height is". This is on the right side of the menu.

steps.title: Select At least.
steps.content: Select At least . This will allow your table's row height to change as you add text.

steps.title: Click OK.
steps.content: Click OK . Your changes will be saved.
